main event: An unidentified flying light was observed in New Mexico on 8 March 1949 at 1835 hours.
interesting points: The object was reported to be larger than a star and appeared intense white with a slight bluish tint at the edge.,The shape was described as elliptical, pointed at each end, resembling a fuselage of a wartime German plane.,It was visible for approximately 1 to 2 seconds before it disappeared into the clouds.,The altitude of the object was estimated to be between 12,000 and 15,000 feet.,Multiple reports from different observers noted the color and behavior of the object, confirming consistency among witnesses.
witnesses: W. E. Patterson and Inspector Leonard Lang from the Atomic Energy Security Service
